The primary objectives were to encourage employment, education, and entrepreneurship. While the initial results showed promising signs, with participants reporting improved well-being and reduced stress, the experiment ultimately failed to achieve its main goals. By the end of the trial, only 22.8% of participants had found employment, and the long-term effects were inconclusive.
